variants.Description in input context: E1285A variant (c.3853G>C) associated with increased kinase activity in Parkinson's disease

Material used.Description: Stable HEK293 cell lines expressing wild-type and E1285A LRRK2 variants were used

Readout description.Result Description: E1285A variant showed 2.3-fold increase in phosphorylation of MAPT compared to wild-type (p<0.01)

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing cells used as positive control

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells used as negative control

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed Student's t-test with Bonferroni correction

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Phosphorylation levels within 20% of wild-type control

Material used.Description: Drosophila models expressing E1285A LRRK2 were analyzed for dopaminergic neuron degeneration

Readout description.Result Description: E1285A-expressing flies showed 40% reduction in dopaminergic neuron count compared to controls (p<0.001)

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type fly brains used as positive control

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transgenic flies used as negative control

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Kruskal-Wallis test with Dunn's post-hoc analysis
